properties.Name: NetworkComponent
properties.Description:
A Network Component is a physical or software component of an electric, gas,  water or telecommunications network involved in the  generation, transmission, distribution or provision of customer services at a service location.

A network component may be related to network infrastructure components or customer/service location components of a network "past the  meter" in the  customer environment (appliances, air conditioning, water heaters etc.).

Infrastructure components are used to generate, maintain and report upon the  network:
- Generating plant
- Transmission line
- Transformer
- Substation
- Power Transmission Pole
- Generator
- Generator BOM Item
- Meter

Customer/Service Location components are used to control, report, bill and service customer appliances and devices attached to the  network:
    - Air conditioner
    - Water heater
    - Home Appliance Network

Each network component has a potential direct or indirect relationship with other network components that can be accessed by its position/level and relationship to related network components.

Columns.Name: ComponentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Component.

Columns.Name: ComponentName
Columns.Description: The name of a Component.

Columns.Name: ComponentDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Component.

Columns.Name: ComponentUtilityAssignedSerialNumber
Columns.Description: The serial number of a component assigned by a utility.

Columns.Name: ElectronicSerialNumber
Columns.Description: The electronic serial number is a unique identification number embedded by manufacturers on a microchip in their product. While the ESN was first commonly used in wireless phones it has found traction in other electronic products.

Columns.Name: MacAddress
Columns.Description: A media access control address (MAC address) of a device is a unique identifier assigned to a network interface controller (NIC) for communications at the data link layer of a network segment. MAC addresses are typically used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

Columns.Name: ManufacturerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Manufacturer.

Columns.Name: ComponentManufacturerName
Columns.Description: The name of the original manufacturer of a Component.

Columns.Name: ComponentManufacturerSerialNumber
Columns.Description: The serial number of the Component originally assigned by the manufacturer.

Columns.Name: ComponentOriginalInstallationTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that a component was originally installed.

Columns.Name: GlobalIndividualAssetIdentifier
Columns.Description: The Global Individual Asset Identifier (GIAI) is a simple tool used to identify an asset by type, uniquely where required. The GIAI is part of the GS1 system of standards.

Columns.Name: ComponentPartIdentifier
Columns.Description: The Component / Part Identifier (CPID) is used to identify components or parts that are used in the assembly of a larger item. The CPID is part of the GS1 system of standards.

Columns.Name: IpAddress
Columns.Description:
A 32-bit or 128-bit numerical label assigned to each device in a computer network that uses the internet protocol communication.

The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (ANA) manages the IP address space allocations.

Columns.Name: CriticalNetworkComponentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that a component is critical for network operation.

Columns.Name: AssetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Asset.

Columns.Name: ComponentTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Component Type.

Columns.Name: LocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: FacilityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Facility.

Columns.Name: CorrosiveQualityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a corrosive quality.

Columns.Name: AccessTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an access type.

Columns.Name: MaterialId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a material.

Columns.Name: FitTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a fit type.

Columns.Name: CoatingConditionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a coating condition.

Columns.Name: CoatingTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a coating type.

Columns.Name: InsulationTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an insulation type.

Columns.Name: ComponentOwnershipTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Component Ownership Type.

Columns.Name: FittingStyleId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a fitting style.

Columns.Name: NetworkId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Network.

Columns.Name: ServiceLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Service Location.

Columns.Name: ComponentCasingTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Component Casing Type.

Columns.Name: ComponentNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding a Component.

Properties.Description:
A Network Component is a physical or software component of an electric, gas,  water or telecommunications network involved in the  generation, transmission, distribution or provision of customer services at a service location.

A network component may be related to network infrastructure components or customer/service location components of a network "past the  meter" in the  customer environment (appliances, air conditioning, water heaters etc.).

Infrastructure components are used to generate, maintain and report upon the  network:
- Generating plant
- Transmission line
- Transformer
- Substation
- Power Transmission Pole
- Generator
- Generator BOM Item
- Meter

Customer/Service Location components are used to control, report, bill and service customer appliances and devices attached to the  network:
    - Air conditioner
    - Water heater
    - Home Appliance Network

Each network component has a potential direct or indirect relationship with other network components that can be accessed by its position/level and relationship to related network components.
